meanings.definition: To promise more than one can deliver.
meanings.sent1: I tend to overpromise my friends about how fast I can run.
meanings.sent2: She always overpromises when it comes to completing her homework on time.
meanings.sent3: Don't overpromise that you can eat ten pizzas in one sitting!
meanings.sent4: His tendency to overpromise turned his job into a never-ending race.
meanings.sent5: The candidate's habit of overpromising made voters skeptical of his abilities.

meanings.definition: To make promises that are unrealistic or impossible to fulfill.
meanings.sent1: The salesman would often overpromise the benefits of his products.
meanings.sent2: It's better to underpromise and overdeliver than to constantly overpromise.
meanings.sent3: She knew she was overpromising when she said she could climb Mount Everest in a day.
meanings.sent4: The CEO's overpromising led to disappointment among the investors.
meanings.sent5: The magician overpromised that he could make an elephant disappear, but it was just a trick.
